required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of ETC-1002 in Subjects With Elevated Blood Cholesterol and Either Normal or Elevated Triglycerides
clinical_study.official_title: A Placebo-Controlled, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel Group, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ETC-1002 in Subjects With Hypercholesterolemia and Either Normal or Elevated Triglycerides.

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase 2 proof-of-concept study will assess the lipid regulating efficacy and safety of ETC-1002 in subjects with hypercholesterolemia and either normal or elevated triglycerides.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Calculated Low-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C)
primary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was calculated as the ([post-Baseline value minus the Baseline value] divided by the Baseline value) x 100. Baseline was defined as the mean of the values from Weeks -1 and 0. Least square (LS) mean percent change from Baseline to Week 12 was based on an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model with effects of treatment and triglyceride (TG) stratum and Baseline value as a covariate. Missing LDL-C values at Week 12 were imputed using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) procedure (only post-Baseline values were carried forward).

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 12 in LDL-C by Triglyceride (TG) Stratum
primary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was calculated as the ([post-Baseline value minus the Baseline value] divided by the Baseline value) x 100. Baseline was defined as the mean of the values from Weeks -1 and 0. LS mean percent change from Baseline to Week 12 was based on an ANCOVA model with effects of treatment and center and Baseline value as a covariate. Missing LDL-C values at Week 12 were imputed using the LOCF procedure (only post-Baseline values were carried forward).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 12 in TG
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was calculated as the ([post-Baseline value minus the Baseline value] divided by the Baseline value) x 100. Baseline was defined as the mean of the values from Weeks -1 and 0. LS mean percent change from Baseline to Week 12 was based on an ANCOVA model with effects of treatment and TG stratum and Baseline value as a covariate. Missing TG values at Week 12 were imputed using the LOCF procedure (only post-Baseline values were carried forward).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 12 in High-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (HDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was calculated as the ([post-Baseline value minus the Baseline value] divided by the Baseline value) x 100. Baseline was defined as the mean of the values from Weeks -1 and 0. LS mean percent change from Baseline to Week 12 was based on an ANCOVA model with effects of treatment and TG stratum and Baseline value as a covariate. Missing HDL-C values at Week 12 were imputed using the LOCF procedure (only post-Baseline values were carried forward).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Apolipoprotein B (ApoB)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was calculated as the ([post-Baseline value minus the Baseline value] divided by the Baseline value) x 100. Baseline was defined as the value from Week 0. LS mean percent change from Baseline to Week 12 was based on an ANCOVA model with effects of treatment and TG stratum and Baseline value as a covariate. Missing ApoB values at Week 12 were imputed using the LOCF procedure (only post-Baseline values were carried forward).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: TEAEs were defined as adverse events (AEs) that began or worsened in severity after the first dose of study medication, occurring up to 30 days after the last dose of study medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Physical Examination Findings
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical significance was determined by the investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Important Changes From Baseline in Vital Sign Values
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical importance was determined by the investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Important Changes From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Values
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical importance was determined by the investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Indicated Abnormal Laboratory Parameter Values at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory abnormalities are laboratory values that are outside the normal range.

arm_group.description: Subjects with hypercholesterolemia and normal triglycerides
Subjects with hypercholesterolemia and normal triglycerides
Subjects with hypercholesterolemia and normal triglycerides
Subjects with hypercholesterolemia and normal triglycerides
Subjects with hypercholesterolemia and elevated triglycerides
Subjects with hypercholesterolemia and elevated triglycerides
Subjects with hypercholesterolemia and elevated triglycerides
Subjects with hypercholesterolemia and elevated triglycerides

criteria.textblock:
Major Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of written informed consent prior to any study-specific procedure
- Fasting LDL-C between 130 and 220 mg/dL following wash-out of all lipid regulating medications and supplements
- Fasting triglyceride <400 mg/dL following wash-out of all lipid regulating medications and supplements
- BMI between 18 and 35 mg/kg2
Major Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant cardiovascular disease, diabetes or uncontrolled hypertension
- Females of child bearing potential (i.e., females who are not surgically sterile or post-menopausal)

results_reference.citation: Ballantyne CM, Davidson MH, Macdougall DE, Bays HE, Dicarlo LA, Rosenberg NL, Margulies J, Newton RS. Efficacy and safety of a novel dual modulator of adenosine triphosphate-citrate lyase and adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase in patients with hypercholesterolemia: results of a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group trial. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2013 Sep 24;62(13):1154-62. doi: 10.1016/j.jacc.2013.05.050. Epub 2013 Jun 13.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 177 participants were enrolled and treated across 11 study sites in the United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During Screening, appropriate participants washed off all lipid-regulating drugs and supplements as necessary for 6 weeks prior to randomization. Participants not taking lipid-regulating medications or supplements for 4 weeks prior to Screening may have combined the S1 and Q1 visits. Participants with hypercholesterolemia were stratified into the normal (<150 milligrams per deciliter [mg/dL]) or elevated (≥150 mg/dL) triglycerides (TG) stratum.

group.title: ETC-1002 40 mg
group.description: Participants received ETC-1002 40 milligrams (mg), orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: ETC-1002 80 mg
group.description: Participants received ETC-1002 80 mg, orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: ETC-1002 120 mg
group.description: Participants received ETC-1002 120 mg, orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo, orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

baseline.population: Baseline data are reported for members of the Safety Population, comprised of all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

measure.description: Baseline was defined as the mean of the values from Weeks -1 and 0.
measure.population: The Overall Number of Baseline Participants analyzed is the sum of the participants in the Normal Stratum and Elevated Stratum.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Calculated Low-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C)
outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was calculated as the ([post-Baseline value minus the Baseline value] divided by the Baseline value) x 100. Least square (LS) mean percent change from Baseline to Week 12 was based on an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model with effects of treatment and triglyceride (TG) stratum and Baseline value as a covariate. Missing LDL-C values at Week 12 were imputed using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) procedure (only post-Baseline values were carried forward).
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population: all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had a Baseline assessment and at least 1 post-Baseline assessment, excluding any assessments taken more than 2 days after a dose of study medication

outcome.population: mITT Population. Only participants with available date were analyzed.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Total LDL Particles
measure.description: Percent change from Baseline was calculated as the ([post-Baseline value minus the Baseline value] divided by the Baseline value) x 100. Baseline was defined as the mean of the values from Week 0. LS mean percent change from Baseline to Week 12 was based on an ANCOVA model with effects of treatment and TG stratum and Baseline value as a covariate. Missing values at Week 12 were imputed using the LOCF procedure (only post-Baseline values were carried forward).
measure.population: mITT Population. Only participants with available date were analyzed.

Missing values at Week 12 were imputed using the LOCF procedure (only post-Baseline values were carried forward).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
outcome.description: TEAEs were defined as adverse events (AEs) that began or worsened in severity after the first dose of study medication, occurring up to 30 days after the last dose of study medication.
outcome.population: Safety Population: all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication

reported_events.desc: Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs), defined as adverse events (AEs) that began or worsened in severity after the first dose of study medication, occurring up to 30 days after the last dose of study medication, are reported. The analysis was performed using the Safety Population, comprised of all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: ETC-1002 40 mg
group.description: Participants received ETC-1002 40 mg, orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: ETC-1002 80 mg
group.description: Participants received ETC-1002 80 mg, orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: ETC-1002 120 mg
group.description: Participants received ETC-1002 120 mg, orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo, orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
